text: TV station KC2XAK of Bridgeport, Connecticut became the first ultra high frequency (UHF) television station to operate a daily schedule.
The first hearing aid using a junction transistor went on sale, the model 1010 manufactured by the Sonotone Corporation in Elmsford, New York, U.S.
Physicist Richard Feynman gave a talk called "There's Plenty of Room at the Bottom", in which he suggested it should be possible to make nanoscale machines that can arrange atoms the way we want.
